text: The Lord’s message came to me:

“<st data-num="01121" class="">Son</st> of <st data-num="0120" class="">man</st>, <st data-num="07760 06440">turn</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">toward</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="02022" class="">Mount</st> <st data-num="08165" class="">Seir</st><n id="2" /> and <st data-num="05012" class="">prophesy</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">against</st> it.

Say to it, ‘This is what the Sovereign Lord says:

“‘Look, I am against you, Mount Seir;

I will stretch out my hand against you

and turn you into a desolate ruin.

I will lay waste your cities,

and you will become desolate.

Then you will know that I am the Lord!
“‘You have shown unrelenting hostility and poured the people of Israel onto the blades of a sword at the time of their calamity, at the time of their final punishment.
Therefore, as surely as I live, declares the Sovereign Lord, I will subject you to bloodshed, and bloodshed will pursue you. Since you did not hate bloodshed, bloodshed will pursue you.

I will <st data-num="05414" class="">turn</st> <st data-num="02022" class="">Mount</st> <st data-num="08165" class="">Seir</st> into a <st data-num="08077" class="">desolate</st> <st data-num="04923" class="">ruin</st>;<n id="1" /> I will <st data-num="03772" class="">cut off</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> it the one who <st data-num="05674" class="">passes through</st> or <st data-num="07725" class="">returns</st>.

I will <st data-num="04390" class="">fill</st> its <st data-num="02022" class="">mountains</st> with its <st data-num="02491" class="">dead</st>; on your <st data-num="01389" class="">hills</st> and in your <st data-num="01516" class="">valleys</st> and in <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> your <st data-num="0650" class="">ravines</st>, those <st data-num="02491" class="">killed</st> by the <st data-num="02719" class="">sword</st> will <st data-num="05307" class="">fall</st>.
I will turn you into a perpetual desolation, and your cities will not be inhabited. Then you will know that I am the Lord.
“‘You said, “These two nations, these two lands will be mine, and we will possess them,” (although the Lord was there);

therefore, as surely as I live, declares the Sovereign Lord, I will deal with you according to your anger and your envy, by which you acted spitefully against them. I will reveal myself to them when I judge you.
Then you will know that I, the Lord, have heard all the insults you spoke against the mountains of Israel, saying, “They are desolate; they have been given to us for food.”

You <st data-num="01431" class="">exalted</st> yourselves <st data-num="05921" class="">against</st> me with your <st data-num="06310" class="">speech</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="06280" class="">hurled many</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">insults</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">against</st> me<n id="2" />—<st data-num="0589" class="">I</st> have <st data-num="08085" class="">heard</st> them all!
This is what the Sovereign Lord says: While the whole earth rejoices, I will turn you into a desolation.

As you rejoiced over the inheritance of the house of Israel because it was desolate, so will I deal with you—you will be desolate, Mount Seir, and all Edom—all of it! Then they will know that I am the Lord.’”
